title: My quick-fix for girls stuck in a toxic social media bubble
text:
There is a growing panic around young people and social media. Ask any parent of a teen or look at the headlines – every week there are stories linking social media to depression, anxiety, self-harm, eating disorders and bullying - and who are said to be worst affected? Girls.

Girls themselves have expressed worries about their wellbeing in the face of an all consuming, 24-hour media. In a poll by Girlguiding, 35 per cent of girls aged 11-21 said their biggest concern online was comparing themselves to others, and 45 per cent felt pressure to check their phones as soon as they wake up and just before they go to sleep.

The problem is intensifying and the stakes seem to be getting higher. Last...
